hypothesis_content.title: Altcoin Correlation Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When the 20-day rolling correlation between the top 10 altcoins (excluding BTC/ETH) compresses below 0.4 (indicating decoupled, idiosyncratic behavior) during a NEUTRAL or BULL regime, and BTC 5-day volatility drops below 25% (annualized), a re-coupling event will occur within 5 trading days, generating mean-reversion alpha by buying the most decoupled altcoin (lowest 5-day correlation to altcoin basket) and shorting the most correlated.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Low correlation during low BTC volatility suggests complacency and fragmented narratives. Historically, such periods precede macro-driven re-couplings (e.g., Fed announcements, BTC sharp moves) where correlation snaps back, punishing extreme decouplings. The trade captures the reversion to a higher correlation regime.
entry_conditions: Identify altcoin with lowest 5-day correlation to basket (long) and highest correlation (short)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Basket correlation returns to > 0.65 OR position PnL reaches +8%
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Basket correlation falls further to < 0.25 OR position PnL reaches -5%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If correlation remains below 0.4 for >10 days post-entry while BTC volatility stays low, or if the decoupled altcoin continues its idiosyncratic trend without reverting.
